commit_message:
Add cache client retry options for the pymemcache backend

This patch specifies a set of options required to setup the retrying
wrapper feature of pymemcache (dogpile.cache) cache backend.

Original oslo.cache change:
https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/oslo.cache/+/803747

Co-Authored-By: Hervé Beraud <hberaud@redhat.com>
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/826869
Change-Id: I34a35b8be54983b926d2d7303dfb400dbf49a8f7

commit_message:
Allow managing ovs bridges separately

This change introduces capability to manage ovs bridges by external
manifests or external tooling, to allow more flexible configuration
which is not available by current interface in ovn::controller.

Change-Id: I7d9be48f99e4f66a08e5dc578cd734c2eaff7eb2

commit_message:
Drop version table from README

... because it's difficult to maintain the table. Basically oslo
libraries are branched and users should select the version from
the appropriate branch.

commit_message:
Dropping explicit unicode literal

In python 3, all strings are considered as unicode string.

This patch drops the explicit unicode literal (u'...')
or (u"..") appearances from the unicode strings.

Change-Id: I4157bb18f107c940d997358768101c65f78a7f51

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: I3559219e8d723dcf23fe107e7585b6f005053224

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: Ic9e267db4934cb95125eebb2ff3b1ca09d64e003

the dib image.

commit_message:
Fix dib ipa jobs

The dib image is based on debian "bullseye" which currently suffers of
two issues:
- does not get an ip when booting
- does not recognize any partition for the EFI installation

The first issue is fixed by the patch in diskimage-builder this patch
depends on.
The second issue is fixed addin the block-device-efi dib element to
the dib image.

Depends-On: I117964a60615a5b7e9984f52f02cd018d1a48ed0

Story: 2009756
Task: 44226

Change-Id: I7ee0bd04f387e7fc2055feeab345f80ca6b3ad0a

subject: Ensure set_configs sets execute bit on directories

While handling permissions for directories, set_configs.py configures them
same as for files - i.e. 0640 set in config.json which works fine for file
will cause any potential subdirectories to lack traverse permission.

commit_message:
Ensure set_configs sets execute bit on directories

While handling permissions for directories, set_configs.py configures them
same as for files - i.e. 0640 set in config.json which works fine for file
will cause any potential subdirectories to lack traverse permission.

Check and permission change was added to handle_permissions function
to add +x if +r is present for user, group, others.

Change-Id: Ic6e3ae4ff40c6ce5a5c0646ed309a2938903f6c0
(cherry picked from commit 1fe983df4fafa5a4a8eafe206e4abfaec2418da1)

commit_message:
Ensure set_configs sets execute bit on directories

While handling permissions for directories, set_configs.py configures them
same as for files - i.e. 0640 set in config.json which works fine for file
will cause any potential subdirectories to lack traverse permission.

Check and permission change was added to handle_permissions function
to add +x if +r is present for user, group, others.

Change-Id: Ic6e3ae4ff40c6ce5a5c0646ed309a2938903f6c0
(cherry picked from commit 1fe983df4fafa5a4a8eafe206e4abfaec2418da1)

commit_message:
Ensure set_configs sets execute bit on directories

While handling permissions for directories, set_configs.py configures them
same as for files - i.e. 0640 set in config.json which works fine for file
will cause any potential subdirectories to lack traverse permission.

Check and permission change was added to handle_permissions function
to add +x if +r is present for user, group, others.

Change-Id: Ic6e3ae4ff40c6ce5a5c0646ed309a2938903f6c0
(cherry picked from commit 1fe983df4fafa5a4a8eafe206e4abfaec2418da1)

[{'created': '2022-02-14 12:57:07.000000000', 'message': 'segments: fix scheduling duplicate segments

It has been reported by bug #1959750 that for a given network the
agent is scheduling all segments reported by agent.

This commit is fixing the issue by ensuring scheduling segments per
network that they belong to only.
A test has been updated to demonstract the fact that for a given
network we only schedule the related segments.

Closes-bug: #1959750

commit_message:
segments: fix scheduling duplicate segments

It has been reported by bug #1959750 that for a given network the
agent is scheduling all segments reported by agent.

This commit is fixing the issue by ensuring scheduling segments per
network that they belong to only.
A test has been updated to demonstract the fact that for a given
network we only schedule the related segments.

Closes-bug: #1959750
Signed-off-by: Sahid Orentino Ferdjaoui <sahid.ferdjaoui@industrialdiscipline.com>
Change-Id: Icd57570004055903c6817a75d814ed65db3fa53c

Change-Id: Ic3aa9eefa481c3ebffa73c3505f2f03205f3ee34
'}, {'created': '2021-11-05 22:44:54.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor mon_host population in Ceph

This PS refactors the way we populate the mon_host string in all of the
Ceph startup scripts that require it.

1) Startup scripts are changed to use a new Helm toolkit function to
   populate the ceph.conf file with the proper mon_host endpoint
   string. There are one or two scripts that only need to retrieve
   the endpoints, and not put them in ceph.conf, so that is the reason
   there are multiple functions defined for this in the Helm toolkit.
2) Some of the deployment and job definition yamls are changed to
   remove the MON_PORT* variables, which are no longer needed.
3) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in ceph-rgw pods,
   which was previously only using mon host FQDNs (problemmatic). This
   required new Role/RoleBinding definitions to be able to reach into
   the "ceph" namespace to get the ceph-mon-discovery endpoint
   information.
4) Removed the ceph-ns-client-ceph-config job from ceph-client as it is
   no longer needed, since all of the Ceph client pods will retrieve the
   mon_host endpoint via the Helm toolkit function in their startup
   script.
5) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in the bootstrap
   job and helm test pod in ceph-client.

Change-Id: Ic3aa9eefa481c3ebffa73c3505f2f03205f3ee34
'}, {'created': '2021-11-08 20:04:58.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor mon_host population in Ceph

This PS refactors the way we populate the mon_host string in all of the
Ceph startup scripts that require it.

1) Startup scripts are changed to use a new Helm toolkit function to
   populate the ceph.conf file with the proper mon_host endpoint
   string. There are one or two scripts that only need to retrieve
   the endpoints, and not put them in ceph.conf, so that is the reason
   there are multiple functions defined for this in the Helm toolkit.
2) Some of the deployment and job definition yamls are changed to
   remove the MON_PORT* variables, which are no longer needed.
3) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in ceph-rgw pods,
   which was previously only using mon host FQDNs (problemmatic). This
   required new Role/RoleBinding definitions to be able to reach into
   the "ceph" namespace to get the ceph-mon-discovery endpoint
   information.
4) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in the bootstrap
   job and helm test pod in ceph-client.

Change-Id: Ic3aa9eefa481c3ebffa73c3505f2f03205f3ee34
'}, {'created': '2021-11-08 20:07:22.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] Refactor mon_host population in Ceph

This PS refactors the way we populate the mon_host string in all of the
Ceph startup scripts that require it.

1) Startup scripts are changed to use a new Helm toolkit function to
   populate the ceph.conf file with the proper mon_host endpoint
   string. There are one or two scripts that only need to retrieve
   the endpoints, and not put them in ceph.conf, so that is the reason
   there are multiple functions defined for this in the Helm toolkit.
2) Some of the deployment and job definition yamls are changed to
   remove the MON_PORT* variables, which are no longer needed.
3) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in ceph-rgw pods,
   which was previously only using mon host FQDNs (problemmatic). This
   required new Role/RoleBinding definitions to be able to reach into
   the "ceph" namespace to get the ceph-mon-discovery endpoint
   information.
4) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in the bootstrap
   job and helm test pod in ceph-client.

Change-Id: Ic3aa9eefa481c3ebffa73c3505f2f03205f3ee34

commit_message:
[WIP] Refactor mon_host population in Ceph

This PS refactors the way we populate the mon_host string in all of the
Ceph startup scripts that require it.

1) Startup scripts are changed to use a new Helm toolkit function to
   populate the ceph.conf file with the proper mon_host endpoint
   string. There are one or two scripts that only need to retrieve
   the endpoints, and not put them in ceph.conf, so that is the reason
   there are multiple functions defined for this in the Helm toolkit.
2) Some of the deployment and job definition yamls are changed to
   remove the MON_PORT* variables, which are no longer needed.
3) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in ceph-rgw pods,
   which was previously only using mon host FQDNs (problemmatic). This
   required new Role/RoleBinding definitions to be able to reach into
   the "ceph" namespace to get the ceph-mon-discovery endpoint
   information.
4) Added capability to populate the mon_host endpoints in the bootstrap
   job and helm test pod in ceph-client.
5) Fixed the ceph-client-bootstrap job so that it can be configured to
   leaves behind pods when it fails, for troubleshooting.

Change-Id: Ic3aa9eefa481c3ebffa73c3505f2f03205f3ee34

subject: Remove OS CI mirror role from fedora(-minimal) tests
messages: [{'account_id': 4146, 'date': '2022-02-18 16:14:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2022-02-18 16:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 34411, 'date': '2022-02-18 16:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7118, 'date': '2022-02-18 21:14:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-18 16:14:12.000000000', 'message': 'Remove OS CI mirror role from fedora(-minimal) tests

The fedora and fedora-minimal elements currently test Fedora <=34. The
opendev ci mirrors no longer mirror Fedora 34 which means we cannot rely
on those mirrors for these tests. Remove the mirror configuration when
testing these older Fedora builds.

Change-Id: I817b412b7f06523df635e8b16111bc1081b40f66
'}]
commit_message:
Remove OS CI mirror role from fedora(-minimal) tests

The fedora and fedora-minimal elements currently test Fedora <=34. The
opendev ci mirrors no longer mirror Fedora 34 which means we cannot rely
on those mirrors for these tests. Remove the mirror configuration when
testing these older Fedora builds.

Change-Id: I817b412b7f06523df635e8b16111bc1081b40f66

subject: CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2022-02-17 08:54:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2022-02-17 08:54:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch bugfix/19.0.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-inspector-tempest-partition-bios-redfish-vmedia
      description: "Inspect and deploy ironic node over Redfish virtual media using legacy BIOS boot mode"
      parent: ironic-tempest-partition-uefi-redfish-vmedia
      required-projects:
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
      vars:
        # NOTE(dtantsur): the inspector job includes booting an instance too.
        # Excluding the abort tests since it hits "node locked" too often.
        tempest_test_regex: test_baremetal_introspection
        devstack_localrc:
          IRONIC_BOOT_MODE: bios
          IRONIC_DEFAULT_BOOT_OPTION: netboot
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGED_BOOT: True
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_NODE_NOT_FOUND_HOOK: ''
          IRONIC_AUTOMATED_CLEAN_ENABLED: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic-inspector: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
        devstack_services:
          ironic-inspector: True
          ironic-inspector-dhcp: True

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@bugfix/19.0", line 264, column 3

commit_message:
CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default

Cirros partition images are not compatible with local boot since they
don't ship grub (nor a normal root partition). This change adds a script
that builds a partition image with UEFI artifacts present. It still
cannot be booted in legacy mode, but it's a progress.

Set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option. We need it to inform
the tempest plugin about the ability to do local boot. This option
already exists but is never set.

Also set the new default_boot_option parameter, which will be introduced
and used in Iaba563a2ecbca029889bc6894b2a7f0754d27b88.

Remove netboot from most of the UEFI jobs.

Change-Id: I15189e7f5928126c6b336b1416ce6408a4950062
(cherry picked from commit bbceca562e0b552cd2fc33b2833931ab3cbbfce5)

commit_message:
Checks for invalid denylist regex patterns

Adds new field check method DenyListFields to validate
the pattern string. in addition, check for a zero
length string as well.

Closes-Bug: #1934252
Change-Id: I2b69025fc11125bb73a4e0f8c0dedad951399cbf

messages: [{'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-02-12 18:25:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/wallaby.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-15 02:56:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:29:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-02-18 19:08:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-12 18:25:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-05 22:39:44.000000000', 'message': 'Fix support for scoped tokens and default roles

This patch is the base patch to enable support for Keystone
scoped tokens[1] and default roles[2] in the Designate API.

It also migrates to using project_id in the context objects instead of
the deprecated tenant_id.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/tokens-overview.html#authorization-scopes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/designate-tempest-plugin/+/821632

Change-Id: I43bb76dc4dc1d167d86fd5ea139a50f95f3b0b4a
(cherry picked from commit 5f87d207b448ec4e24988af5671c3b3593b13804)
(cherry picked from commit ad87c95e2c9a92149f62cdcbee4326dca457e2aa)

commit_message:
Fix support for scoped tokens and default roles

This patch is the base patch to enable support for Keystone
scoped tokens[1] and default roles[2] in the Designate API.

It also migrates to using project_id in the context objects instead of
the deprecated tenant_id.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/tokens-overview.html#authorization-scopes
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/keystone/latest/admin/service-api-protection.html

Change-Id: I43bb76dc4dc1d167d86fd5ea139a50f95f3b0b4a
(cherry picked from commit 5f87d207b448ec4e24988af5671c3b3593b13804)
(cherry picked from commit ad87c95e2c9a92149f62cdcbee4326dca457e2aa)

commit_message:
Use native ansible module to control dnf module_hotfixes

This has been possible since ansible 2.11 so we use the built
in functionality. This should be idempotent and does not
require an additional task.

Change-Id: I0bec6f705d0fbc0b593f19100262912f7b0de4c1

commit_message:
Fix grenade job for mod_wsgi to uwsgi transition

This patch updates the grenade job to migrate from using Apache mod_wsgi
to using uwsgi for the Designate API when upgrading from Xena to Yoga.

It also splits out the wsgi devstack configuration into a library file.

Change-Id: Icf8ee4a8e7e2dff67257b0e5f82fbeab6cb7e0b8

commit_message:
Update master for stable/yoga

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/yoga.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/yoga.

Sem-Ver: feature
Change-Id: I8f2e1f690e3f47f7f34c7dfe53886be129e3d891

commit_message:
Log what exception caused abort of the transaction

In some cases, when ovsdb transaction is aborted, knowing what error
caused that can help to understand the root cause of the problem
so this patch adds such logging on the DEBUG level.

Change-Id: Ic67575ff26c689ec8ab1a5c619ae0b0a2846b05f
(cherry picked from commit dc15bfd5729eb9f2b404288a4aa901c318274507)

so this patch adds such logging on the DEBUG level.

commit_message:
Refactor use of include_vars

Use a first_found lookup instead of a with_first_found loop so that
the 'paths' parameter can be used.

This ensures that only vars from the role are included, and not vars
from a parent calling role. This can happen when a parent role has
a higher priority vars file available for inclusion than the role
it calls.

Change-Id: I526486a8644a8d2065a720657603ddff3c6bdaec

commit_message:
WIP: api-ref: Added cluster section and endpoints

The api-ref documentation was missing the cluster endpoints which
were introduced on api version 3.7.

This patch adds a section for cluster with its endpoints.
Also update the parameters file to contain the cluster variables and
created a directory for cluster responses samples.

Closes-Bug: 1885544
Change-Id: Ieb9e75a1fd20a36defd1b6e15f4a1792f96e1f24

commit_message:
Log what exception caused abort of the transaction

In some cases, when ovsdb transaction is aborted, knowing what error
caused that can help to understand the root cause of the problem
so this patch adds such logging on the DEBUG level.

Change-Id: Ic67575ff26c689ec8ab1a5c619ae0b0a2846b05f
(cherry picked from commit dc15bfd5729eb9f2b404288a4aa901c318274507)

commit_message:
Log what exception caused abort of the transaction

In some cases, when ovsdb transaction is aborted, knowing what error
caused that can help to understand the root cause of the problem
so this patch adds such logging on the DEBUG level.

Change-Id: Ic67575ff26c689ec8ab1a5c619ae0b0a2846b05f
(cherry picked from commit dc15bfd5729eb9f2b404288a4aa901c318274507)

commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/yoga

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/yoga branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: I31610bd820eaa8a9ea27facc021f7521401ad9ee

[{'created': '2022-02-05 16:40:18.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I3174f715be88ed7cd5047931f74c0ff82117f52b
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I3174f715be88ed7cd5047931f74c0ff82117f52b

commit_message:
Refactor vnfm_db

vnfm_db.py has the following problems.

(i) ``_update_vnf_scaling`` and ``_update_vnf_rollback`` save these two
unrelated objects: vnf_instance and vnf_lcm_op_occ. These objects are
not updated in these functions, but in vnflcm_driver. Thus, saving these
objects should be done in vnflcm_driver.

(ii) ``_update_vnf_rollback_status_err``, ``_update_vnf_rollback_pre``
and ``_update_vnf_rollback`` have a redundant else block.

This patch solves these problems as follows.

(i) Moved lines saving the objects to ``vnflcm_driver``
(ii) Removed redundant else block

Change-Id: I5feb5385bc5a186c1e6f1db742a2fe02e472ad16

commit_message:
Revert "Update rbd warning message"

This reverts commit b7e294599047188a04f91dda53537b262d2b3f8d.

Reason for revert: From the pacific documentation[1] it looks
like --pool is still valid. Ceph bug:
https://tracker.ceph.com/issues/53125#change-208888

[1] https://docs.ceph.com/en/pacific/man/8/rbd/

Change-Id: I29245df29edc6f0e46e3eada74a4066ffd66e2cb

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-01-18 15:23:14.000000000', 'message': "Make the dead vlan actually dead

All ports plugged into the dead vlan (DEAD_VLAN_TAG 4095 or 0xfff)
should not be able to send or receive traffic. We install a flow
to br-int to drop all traffic of the dead vlan [1]. However before
this patch the flow we install looks like:

priority=65535,vlan_tci=0x0fff/0x1fff actions=drop

Which is wrong and it usually does not match anything.

According to ovs-fields (7) section Open vSwitch Extension VLAN Field,
VLAN TCI Field [2] (see especially the usage example
vlan_tci=0x1123/0x1fff) we need to explicitly set the bit 0x1000
to match the presence of an 802.1Q header.

Setting that bit this flow becomes:
priority=65535,vlan_tci=0x1fff/0x1fff actions=drop

which is equivalent to:
priority=65535,dl_vlan=4095 actions=drop

which should match and drop dead vlan traffic.

However there's a second problem: ovs access ports were designed to
work together with the NORMAL action. The NORMAL action considers the
vlan of an access port, but the openflow pipeline does not. An openflow
rule does not see the vlan set for an access port, because that vlan
tag is only pushed to the frame if and when the frame leaves the switch
on a trunk port [3][4].

So we have to explicitly push the DEAD_VLAN_TAG if we want the dead
vlan's drop flow match anything.

That means we are adding a flow to push the dead vlan tag from
dhcp-agent/l3-agent but we are deleting that flow from ovs-agent right
after ovs-agent sets the vlan tag of the port to a non-dead vlan. Which
is ugly but we have to keep adding the flow as early as possible if we
want to minimize the window until frames can leak onto the dead vlan.
Even with this change there's a short time window in which the dead vlan
could theoretically leak.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/commit/ecdc11a56448428f77f5a64fd028f1e4c9644ea3/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/br_int.py#L60-L62
[2] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-fields.7.html
[3] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2021-December/051647.html
[4] https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/faq/vlan/
    see 'Q: My OpenFlow controller doesn’t see the VLANs that I expect.'

Change-Id: Ib6b70114efb140cf1393b57ebc350fea4b0a2443
Closes-Bug: #1930414
(cherry picked from commit 7aae31c9f9ed938760ca0be3c461826b598c7004)
(cherry picked from commit 5025a6a7274df13436fe540a044710337a3d8236)
(cherry picked from commit 9f5b745a5eaceb503b5a4eb85f786dab7e8e071e)
"}]
commit_message:
Make the dead vlan actually dead

All ports plugged into the dead vlan (DEAD_VLAN_TAG 4095 or 0xfff)
should not be able to send or receive traffic. We install a flow
to br-int to drop all traffic of the dead vlan [1]. However before
this patch the flow we install looks like:

priority=65535,vlan_tci=0x0fff/0x1fff actions=drop

Which is wrong and it usually does not match anything.

According to ovs-fields (7) section Open vSwitch Extension VLAN Field,
VLAN TCI Field [2] (see especially the usage example
vlan_tci=0x1123/0x1fff) we need to explicitly set the bit 0x1000
to match the presence of an 802.1Q header.

Setting that bit this flow becomes:
priority=65535,vlan_tci=0x1fff/0x1fff actions=drop

which is equivalent to:
priority=65535,dl_vlan=4095 actions=drop

which should match and drop dead vlan traffic.

However there's a second problem: ovs access ports were designed to
work together with the NORMAL action. The NORMAL action considers the
vlan of an access port, but the openflow pipeline does not. An openflow
rule does not see the vlan set for an access port, because that vlan
tag is only pushed to the frame if and when the frame leaves the switch
on a trunk port [3][4].

So we have to explicitly push the DEAD_VLAN_TAG if we want the dead
vlan's drop flow match anything.

That means we are adding a flow to push the dead vlan tag from
dhcp-agent/l3-agent but we are deleting that flow from ovs-agent right
after ovs-agent sets the vlan tag of the port to a non-dead vlan. Which
is ugly but we have to keep adding the flow as early as possible if we
want to minimize the window until frames can leak onto the dead vlan.
Even with this change there's a short time window in which the dead vlan
could theoretically leak.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/src/commit/ecdc11a56448428f77f5a64fd028f1e4c9644ea3/neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/native/br_int.py#L60-L62
[2] http://www.openvswitch.org/support/dist-docs/ovs-fields.7.html
[3] https://mail.openvswitch.org/pipermail/ovs-discuss/2021-December/051647.html
[4] https://docs.openvswitch.org/en/latest/faq/vlan/
    see 'Q: My OpenFlow controller doesn’t see the VLANs that I expect.'

Change-Id: Ib6b70114efb140cf1393b57ebc350fea4b0a2443
Closes-Bug: #1930414
(cherry picked from commit 7aae31c9f9ed938760ca0be3c461826b598c7004)
(cherry picked from commit 5025a6a7274df13436fe540a044710337a3d8236)
(cherry picked from commit 9f5b745a5eaceb503b5a4eb85f786dab7e8e071e)

[{'created': '2022-01-19 17:57:34.000000000', 'message': 'PowerMax docs -  Include a note in cinder backup section

Note to highlight that the rpc_response_timeout will need
to be increased, especially in replication scenarios where
the create operation will take longer.

Change-Id: I0c1b1edb29e374cb9d9eefa87c2f27a9b97d86a5
'}]
commit_message:
PowerMax docs -  Include a note in cinder backup section

Note to highlight that the rpc_response_timeout will need
to be increased, especially in replication scenarios where
the create operation will take longer.

Change-Id: I0c1b1edb29e374cb9d9eefa87c2f27a9b97d86a5

commit_message:
Use native ansible module to control dnf module_hotfixes

in functionality. This should be idempotent and does not
require an additional task.

subject: Cinder store: Wait for device resize
messages:
[{'account_id': 27615, 'date': '2022-02-17 18:31:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch stable/xena.'}, {'account_id': 9303, 'date': '2022-02-17 18:40:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 5314, 'date': '2022-02-18 14:57:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-17 18:31:53.000000000', 'message': 'Cinder store: Wait for device resize

When we have an image with size > 1 GB, we follow the following steps
to accomodate the image:
1) Detach the volume
2) extend the volume
3) Attach the volume
4) Open the volume device as a file and resume writing the image

Sometimes due to several reasons (mostly network related), the
size of the device file could mismatch with the actual volume size
(or the backend LUN size). This can happen if the extend was performed
(i.e. the control path) but it takes the time to reflect that into
the mapped device (i.e. the data path). This mismatch can cause the
issue "IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device".
To avoid this scenario, we check if the device size is less than the
volume size, we wait for the extended LUN to show up in mapped device
and then continue the image writing operation.

Closes-Bug: #1959913

Change-Id: I206580f6be615ebc5e15b546b9c23728d4116a5d
(cherry picked from commit f3433ed1a5176bff85b3fe04dba2d4c76618a299)
(cherry picked from commit ea5139be9a76ca8c2e60d12d8dd776bff39c4579)
'}]
commit_message:
Cinder store: Wait for device resize

When we have an image with size > 1 GB, we follow the following steps
to accomodate the image:
1) Detach the volume
2) extend the volume
3) Attach the volume
4) Open the volume device as a file and resume writing the image

Sometimes due to several reasons (mostly network related), the
size of the device file could mismatch with the actual volume size
(or the backend LUN size). This can happen if the extend was performed
(i.e. the control path) but it takes the time to reflect that into
the mapped device (i.e. the data path). This mismatch can cause the
issue "IOError: [Errno 28] No space left on device".
To avoid this scenario, we check if the device size is less than the
volume size, we wait for the extended LUN to show up in mapped device
and then continue the image writing operation.

Closes-Bug: #1959913

Change-Id: I206580f6be615ebc5e15b546b9c23728d4116a5d
(cherry picked from commit f3433ed1a5176bff85b3fe04dba2d4c76618a299)
(cherry picked from commit ea5139be9a76ca8c2e60d12d8dd776bff39c4579)

commit_message:
Update to classic charms to build using charmcraft in CI

This update is to ensure that the Zuul Canonical CI builds the charm
before functional tests and ensure that that artifact is used for the
functional tests.  This is to try to ensure that the charm that gets
landed to the charmhub is the same charm that was tested with.

Change-Id: Ia2f3bcba500de242a93d9f0bf073a9c5c3aad89a

[{'created': '2021-01-28 12:54:01.000000000', 'message': 'PowerFlex documentation contains invalid paths

The latest documentation for Dell EMC PowerFlex driver
(rebranded from VxFlex OS) contains invalid paths for
the connector configuration file that can make it
impossible to perform attach/detach operations.

Closes-Bug: #1913578
'}]
commit_message:
PowerFlex documentation contains invalid paths

The latest documentation for Dell EMC PowerFlex driver
(rebranded from VxFlex OS) contains invalid paths for
the connector configuration file that can make it
impossible to perform attach/detach operations.

Change-Id: I27921a5641abab3815d8ce7404f680c98e163520
Closes-Bug: #1913578

commit_message:
Release final neutron-lib for Yoga

This proposed a release for neutron-lib to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 18.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ib79171d06b30d8d5fca6103fcad225342d5a1daf

commit_message:
Release final ovsdbapp for Yoga

This proposed a release for ovsdbapp to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 18.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Release final oslo.policy for Yoga

This proposed a release for oslo.policy to get any final merged changes
out prior to the lib freeze for Yoga going into effect.

If the team is ready to proceed, please leave a +1 to acknowledge this
release and we will process right away. If the team is working on any
final merges, leave a -1 with some detail on the status and update the
patch with the new commit hash to use when ready.

Patches with no response will be merged by Friday, February 18.

Signed-off-by: Daniel Bengtsson <dbengt@redhat.com>
Change-Id: I0b01b85c9b35ee993e8b2868fc38c3a5dc8f6272

commit_message:
Run the SSL verification at step2

Run the SSL verification at step2 instead of host_prep as we need
to have CACerts injected before being able to validate the SSL
certificates.  It looks like NodeTLSCerts is getting deprecated
and CI has already moved away from taht method .

Change-Id: I5e3491efd12ad2445a3d77f0907fbb766fe54466
Closes-bug: #1961056

commit_message:
[WIP] Enable Neutron ML2 DNS and tests

Xena onwards for now, enable back to Ussuri once various in-flight
backports succeed.

Func-Test-Pr: https://github.com/openstack-charmers/zaza-openstack-tests/pull/687
Change-Id: I86c9e817776a2b61d0edf7813e9f3c6b3739a6c0

prepare.yml. Also, taking a copy of /etc/default/grub before converging
and restoring it during the cleanup phase.

commit_message:
Creating a default molecule config

We should use a default molecule configuration off a base file and
override as necessary. Since all roles' molecule.yml are complete,
this base configuration shouldn't interfer with what's currently
in place.

Change-Id: I051ccd65166432c07891f963ee06af53df91a332

(4 comments)

This requires a release note ( https://docs.openstack.org/kolla-ansible/latest/contributor/release-notes.html ).

After fixing the issues, this will be +2 from my side because it follows other VMware stuff we have.
Though bear in mind there is no VMware testing in CI and, as it looks from the nova.conf file, it was broken for quite a few cycles unless someone overrode manually.'}, {'account_id': 33952, 'date': '2021-09-08 13:18:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 33952, 'date': '2021-09-08 13:22:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

commit_message:
Add support for VMware NSXP

NSXP is the OpenStack support for the NSX Policy platform.
This is supported from neutron in the Stein version. This patch
adds Kolla support

This adds a new neutron_plugin_agent type 'vmware_nsxp'. The plugin
does not run any neutron agents.

Change-Id: I9e9d8f07e586bdc143d293e572031368af7f3fca

* prometheus_node_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_openstack_exporter_cmdline_extras

Change-Id: I5da2031b9367115384045775c515628e2acb1aa4
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to define extra parameters for Prometheus exporters

The following variables are added:

* prometheus_blackbox_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_elasticsearch_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_haproxy_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_memcached_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_mysqld_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_node_exporter_cmdline_extras
* prometheus_openstack_exporter_cmdline_extras

Change-Id: I5da2031b9367115384045775c515628e2acb1aa4

[{'created': '2021-12-17 16:29:10.000000000', 'message': 'Implement deferred service restart NRPE check

* New check alerts on CRITICAL when deferred restarts are detected
* New check only runs when `enable-auto-restarts` is False
    * Check is removed when `enable-auto-restarts` returns to True
* [TEMP] changes needed in charmhelpers are temporarily added in this
  MR.

commit_message:
Add NRPE checks for deferred service restarts

* Alert on "CRITICAL" when services with deferred restarts are detected.
* The check is active only when `enable-auto-restarts` is False

Co-authored-by: Connor Chamberlain <connor.chamberlain@canonical.com>
Change-Id: Ic67a40dfe87ed87539ecc724e09983683b14b016

commit_message:
Remove unused host driver

The HostDriver class contained one method get_all_block_devices which
was used in iscsi connector to get all devices in "/dev/disk/by-path/"
location and is unused since change I058ff0a0e5ad517507dc3cda39087c913558561d
This patch removes the leftover unused code.

Change-Id: Iabc61751f08e4d9bf0b513931c2a80430a7e8036

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> Just a quick note, this image will need few adjustements in time as it won't support offline build scenario as the exporter is source builded and a go build will call for github url internally that won't work within an infrastructure that is behind a firewall/proxy.

Thanks Fl1nt, as golang respects the regular ENV variables for proxies, wouldn't instructions from https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/image-building.html#building-behind-a-proxy just work? Do you build in an offline scenario on your own? Have this image failed to build?"}, {'account_id': 32398, 'date': '2021-09-22 07:38:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 9:

> Patch Set 9:
> 
> > Patch Set 9:
> > 
> > Just a quick note, this image will need few adjustements in time as it won't support offline build scenario as the exporter is source builded and a go build will call for github url internally that won't work within an infrastructure that is behind a firewall/proxy.
> 
> Thanks Fl1nt, as golang respects the regular ENV variables for proxies, wouldn't instructions from https://docs.openstack.org/kolla/latest/admin/image-building.html#building-behind-a-proxy just work? Do you build in an offline scenario on your own? Have this image failed to build?

Yes, the ENV would be used in case of offline scenario behind a proxy, however, I rather thought about a air-gapped environment that would need to either provide an internal URL to an already compiled binary version of the exporter. This case would require a conditional if on the build block."}, {'account_id': 13252, 'date': '2022-01-04 09:42:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

commit_message:
Add Prometheus libvirt exporter image

This adds a libvirt exporter image for use with Prometheus.

Partially-Implements: blueprint libvirt-exporter

Reparent content provider job

Creating a general content provider job with options,
and use that job as parent for c8 and c9 content provider.

commit_message:
Remove ineffective pick functions

The rally class doesn't have any database parameters thus the logic
to pick these parameters are never used.

Change-Id: I77dbb47ebe0af89b8dede09b3f675c740eb7bc0c

subject: Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 09:25:22.000000000', 'message': 'Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails

When trying to attach a volume to an already running instance the nova-api
requests the nova-compute service to create a BlockDeviceMapping. If the
nova-api does not receive a response within `rpc_response_timeout` it will
treat the request as failed and raise an exception.

There are multiple cases where nova-compute actually already processed the
request and just the reply did not reach the nova-api in time (see bug report).
After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry
for the volume + instance combination that will never be cleaned up again.
This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527
(cherry picked from commit 9eb116b99ce32bc69c4abf8ec3b0179ef89a8860)

This allows users to try the request again.

commit_message:
Gracefull recovery when attaching volume fails

When trying to attach a volume to an already running instance the nova-api
requests the nova-compute service to create a BlockDeviceMapping. If the
nova-api does not receive a response within `rpc_response_timeout` it will
treat the request as failed and raise an exception.

There are multiple cases where nova-compute actually already processed the
request and just the reply did not reach the nova-api in time (see bug report).
After the failed request the database will contain a BlockDeviceMapping entry
for the volume + instance combination that will never be cleaned up again.
This entry also causes the nova-api to reject all future attachments of this
volume to this instance (as it assumes it is already attached).

To work around this we check if a BlockDeviceMapping has already been created
when we see a messaging timeout. If this is the case we can safely delete it
as the compute node has already finished processing and we will no longer pick
it up.
This allows users to try the request again.

A previous fix was abandoned but without a clear reason ([1]).

[1]: https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/nova/+/731804

Closes-Bug: 1960401
Change-Id: I17f4d7d2cb129c4ec1479cc4e5d723da75d3a527
(cherry picked from commit 9eb116b99ce32bc69c4abf8ec3b0179ef89a8860)

commit_message:
Refactor FT of sol job

To validate functional test cases for multi tenant policy
in Lifecycle Management.
The proposed design is to create different tenants and users
and verify LCM operations.

This patch includes the following changes,
* Customize VIM configuration file in BaseTackerTest class,
  to create authentication token for multiple tenants.
* Change base class functions in BaseVnfLcmTest to pass different
  OpenStack clients as arguments. And move common code in
  BaseVnfLcmTest into functions.
* Customize functions to set fake HTTP server as per tenant in
  class BaseVnfLcmTest.

Implement: blueprint multi-tenant-policy
Change-Id: I45c3f05b3e86d04abfd66a2d7053392b4b75aa90

commit_message:
Build the new cirros image even when netboot is the default

The standalone job changes boot_option in runtime, so local boot
can be used even when the default boot option is netboot.

Change-Id: Ia538907f3662e8cd84d988ea5d862c7f488558e1

commit_message:
FT Setup to test multi-tenant policy in LCM

To validate functional test cases in Zuul environment this
patch adds a new Ansible playbook. This playbook helps in
creating two different OpenStack projects, users to
validate multi tenant policy in Lifecycle Management.

In current design, tacker uses an administrator role user
"nfv_user" to execute functional test cases. Whereas this
patch adds member role (non administrator user) to newly
created users.

Generates OpenStack VIM config files using helper script and
register default VIMs to respective tenants.
Additionally copies newly generated VIM config files to
"tacker/tacker/tests/etc/samples" folder as these are required
in functional test cases.

Partial Implement: blueprint multi-tenant-policy

Change-Id: I20491eb294e5653bcdc2864885f55d04b21696a1

messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-15 15:00:14.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-15 15:05:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-15 15:17:39.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2022-02-16 15:04:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-18 04:21:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-15 15:00:14.000000000', 'message': 'Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql

The puppt-postgresql module does not support CentOS 9 yet and requires
some version parameters to be run on CentOS 9. This change disables
unit tests requiring that module, until the module supports CentOS 9.

Change-Id: Icff8be15e0180d620488a80504208c12b8be6aac
'}, {'created': '2022-02-15 15:05:16.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql

The puppt-postgresql module does not support CentOS 9 yet and requires
some version parameters to be run on CentOS 9. This change disables
unit tests requiring that module, until the module supports CentOS 9.

Change-Id: Icff8be15e0180d620488a80504208c12b8be6aac
'}, {'created': '2022-02-15 15:17:39.000000000', 'message': 'CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql

The puppt-postgresql module does not support CentOS 9 yet and requires
some version parameters to be run on CentOS 9. This change disables
unit tests requiring that module, until the module supports CentOS 9.

Change-Id: Icff8be15e0180d620488a80504208c12b8be6aac
'}]
commit_message:

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-10 22:15:16.000000000', 'message': "Refactor ceph job definition.

There's some weirdness going on with the ceph job. Since it's not
triggered often, it has gone unnoticed until [1]. No openstack
services are started on the subnode, and the only test ran in the job
fails. This appears to be pretty consistently reproducible, at least
lately.

Try to fix this by making our ceph job inherit from the base
devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3 job, and trimming down vars
in the job definition that are no longer needed.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/+/779043

Change-Id: I6a576c0c54411bc83d482fb2db53cdae9033c19e

"}, {'created': '2022-02-11 02:29:51.000000000', 'message': "Refactor ceph job definition

triggered often, it has gone unnoticed until [1]. No openstack
services are started on the subnode, and the only test ran in the job
fails. This appears to be pretty consistently reproducible, at least
lately.

I'm not exactly sure how or why, but it appears that to fix this, we
can make our ceph job inherit from the base
devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3 job. This means we have to
dupliate some whitebox-specific declarations, but it looks to work
better this way rather than inheriting from the base whitebox job and
duplicating the ceph declarations.

Also, since this job only runs storage tests, we don't need nested
KVM, and can use whatever nodeset we inherit from
devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/+/779043

Change-Id: I6a576c0c54411bc83d482fb2db53cdae9033c19e

Change-Id: I6a576c0c54411bc83d482fb2db53cdae9033c19e
"}, {'created': '2022-02-11 21:52:09.000000000', 'message': "Refactor ceph job definition

There's some weirdness going on with the ceph job once it gets
combined with barbican in the subsequent patch. No openstack services
are started on the subnode, and the only test ran in the job fails.
This appears to be pretty consistently reproducible.

Sidestep the problem entirely by switching our ceph job to inehrit
from the base devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3 job. This
way, our whitebox-devstack-multinode job can get barbican in the
subsequent patch, and leave the ceph job barbican-less.

This does mean we have to duplicate some whitebox-specific
declarations in the ceph job, but it's not really worse than what we
had before, inheriting from the whitebox base job and duplicating the
*ceph job* declarations.

Also, since this job only runs storage tests, we don't need nested
KVM, and can use whatever nodeset we inherit from
devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/+/779043

Change-Id: I6a576c0c54411bc83d482fb2db53cdae9033c19e
"}]
commit_message:
Refactor ceph job definition

There's some weirdness going on with the ceph job once it gets
combined with barbican in the subsequent patch. No openstack services
are started on the subnode, and the only test ran in the job fails.
This appears to be pretty consistently reproducible.

Sidestep the problem entirely by switching our ceph job to inehrit
from the base devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3 job. This
way, our whitebox-devstack-multinode job can get barbican in the
subsequent patch, and leave the ceph job barbican-less.

This does mean we have to duplicate some whitebox-specific
declarations in the ceph job, but it's not really worse than what we
had before, inheriting from the whitebox base job and duplicating the
*ceph job* declarations.

Also, since this job only runs storage tests, we don't need nested
KVM, and can use whatever nodeset we inherit from
devstack-plugin-ceph-multinode-tempest-py3.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/c/openstack/whitebox-tempest-plugin/+/779043

commit_message:
Use TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE and update tox

UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE is old name and deprecated
This allows to use upper-constraints file as more
readable way instead of UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE=<lower-constraints file>.

bumps min version of tox to 3.18.0 in order to replace tox's
whitelist_externals by allowlist_externals option:
https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/blob/master/docs/changelog.rst#v3180-2020-07-23

Change-Id: I4b14b7882fd6806c864d5ac0445e45df450dc218

revisions:
[{'created': '2021-03-24 23:13:04.000000000', 'message': 'Fix API reference for list service statuses

The API reference incorrectly listed the URL path for list service
statuses as /v2/service_status.
This patch corrects that to the actual path and adds compatiblity
for the /v2/service_status path in the code in case there are
users or libraries coded to the incorrect path.

Closes-Bug: #1919183
Change-Id: I3cdf0f8dcde12891e244822480270aec48e0df0d
'}]
commit_message:
Fix API reference for list service statuses

The API reference incorrectly listed the URL path for list service
statuses as /v2/service_status.
This patch corrects that to the actual path and adds compatiblity
for the /v2/service_status path in the code in case there are
users or libraries coded to the incorrect path.

Closes-Bug: #1919183
Change-Id: I3cdf0f8dcde12891e244822480270aec48e0df0d

commit_message:
sharder: refactor _cleave_shard_range

Move most of the method to a helper so that there is a place that
receives the multiple return points, before finally returning the
result.

Change-Id: I48e18beeb32372a287e8297f0870e8627147141f

commit_message:
Use stestr instead of testr

This commit makes to use stestr instead of testr as a test runner. The
testrepository project is inactive now. We can see some backgrounds in
this ML[1].

[1] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-September/122135.html

Change-Id: I408335cd55f67c7ad0165bce1343bd0a77d2b533

commit_message:
tuned - check packages before install

When repository files are present, but the ctlplane is not on a
routed network. (I.e the node cannot connect to repositories.)
The ansible built in `package` will fail despite the fact that
the packages is already installed.

This change adds a task to check that the packages required are
installed using `rpm --query --whatprovides <PGK_LIST>`. Pacage
installation task is skipped if package already installed.

Related: RHBZ#2048134
Related-Bug: #1959731
Change-Id: Ifcbde65af99039a261bc34a813bddfb29f63c1e1
(cherry picked from commit 5c09c0ee0292be370455b79e4bd4991b513b8017)
(cherry picked from commit a6813adb567baea57146e90493cbf16c648692a8)

commit_message:
tripleo-bootstrap - check packeges fact befor install

When repository files are present, but the ctlplane is not on a
routed network. (I.e the node cannot connect to repositories.)
The ansible built in `package` will fail despite the fact that
the packages is already installed.

This change adds a task to check that the packages required are
isntalled using `rpm --query --whatprovides <PGK_LIST>`.
`--whatprovides` is used to find out if a wrapper rpm for OVS with
custom versioning scheme is installed. If a wrapper is installed
'openvswitch' is appended to the list of installed packages.

Related: RHBZ#2048134
Closes-Bug: #1959731
Change-Id: Ie448e8f795325cc3ae357fae32f3a47406101f25
(cherry picked from commit 37fac649388e0bf39326bdaaefa5a104b6ef264c)
(cherry picked from commit 7b002dec7dd32322023487f78cf7944aee7b1c46)

commit_message:
Updated devstack to handle rpc changes properly with wsgi

- Moved functions into lib/designate.
- Split backend functions out of regular designate functions.
- Use stop / start designate in upgrade script.

Change-Id: I41402fb4634cc13aba434caf878073a5f91a81bc

commit_message:
[train-only][ffwd] Fix pacemaker container selinux context

Change If796d3c1d37c72655bd6b99e851a3b3e7617b9a4 introduced
upgrade tasks fixing the selinux context but in some cases
only for non pacemaker controlled services while majority
of the installations use the pacemaker controlled ones.

Resolves-bug: rhbz#2021525
Change-Id: I0038872197f34d8a1acd954f90b5b69281cea7dc

messages:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-13 01:19:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-13 19:52:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-12 18:25:21.000000000', 'message': 'Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)

subject: Fix OS_CLOUD for multistack and nova az tasks
messages: [{'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2022-02-10 14:19:38.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 23811, 'date': '2022-02-14 12:57:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\n(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 18002, 'date': '2022-02-16 17:28:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:46:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-10 14:19:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix OS_CLOUD for multistack and nova az tasks

The entry in clouds.yaml will correspond to the stack that deploys
keystone. Therefore in a multistack deployment RootStackName will not be
give the correct entry. Add a parameter to override this.

Also clouds.yaml is owned by root and mode 0600 so we much use
become: true.

Update nova az tasks to use clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: I7e97108d8165c16946b3b11f3084bfd51e3128dc

commit_message:
Fix OS_CLOUD for multistack and nova az tasks

The entry in clouds.yaml will correspond to the stack that deploys
keystone. Therefore in a multistack deployment RootStackName will not be
give the correct entry. Add a parameter to override this.

Also clouds.yaml is owned by root and mode 0600 so we much use
become: true.

Update nova az tasks to use clouds.yaml.

Change-Id: I7e97108d8165c16946b3b11f3084bfd51e3128dc
(cherry picked from commit ceed5ac9e71e7c4b113ffa8e16a8167190312b47)

commit_message:
json_rpc: accept system scope credential

This change allows users to use system-scoped credential for [json_rpc]
parameters, instead of project-scoped credential.

Change-Id: I4523b0dc508d7c3f6fc1bcbfb85bbd8f7b599038

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-12 18:25:33.000000000', 'message': 'Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix recordset_records quota enforcement

First I set recordset_records=3, and I can create recordset with 4 records
successfully.
Now enforce record quota by count records in database. when create recordset
the number in database is 0., and quotas will not work no matter how much
quota recordset_records are set. And once the excess quota is created
successfully, it can not be updated. Unless quotas are updated.

Closes-Bug: #1847200

Change-Id: If8bc6043d95f52f67899a5ac69a2f72c8fd4de17
(cherry picked from commit df10ff5b5c76657e4287b36fbf525ad91091dd34)

commit_message:
Improve error messag if subnet is not found

If a subnet that does not exist the error returned is:
 "Error managing network ports 'intenal_api_leaf2'"

This patch improves this by raising a more informative
error message.

Change-Id: Ic52d8c630d809efdabd10ec921deff83bbcd86bf
(cherry picked from commit 5558f97b2c6d8946d7b01b14db49e5a8a5c75948)

commit_message:
Exclude /etc/openldap to avoid overriding ro file

Currently /etc/openldap is bind-mounted by keystone containers
with ro flag so it should be excluded from config files generaed
by puppet.

Closes-Bug: #1960781
Change-Id: I8027b829e6b5aebfcd36f5025bb9c848cc96ce3f

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 11090, 'name': 'Sergii Golovatiuk', 'email': 'sgolovat@redhat.com', 'username': 'holser'}, {'_account_id': 18575, 'name': 'Saravanan KR', 'email': 'krsacme@gmail.com', 'username': 'saravanankr'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 32432, 'name': 'Owen McGonagle', 'email': 'omcgonag@redhat.com', 'username': 'omcgonag'}, {'_account_id': 33080, 'name': 'Mikolaj Ciecierski', 'display_name': 'Mikolaj Ciecierski', 'email': 'mciecier@redhat.com', 'username': 'mciecierski'}]
messages: [{'account_id': 26343, 'date': '2022-02-14 11:13:27.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11090, 'date': '2022-02-14 13:01:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18575, 'date': '2022-02-16 12:47:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:44:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-14 11:13:27.000000000', 'message': "Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for updates.

In the minor update workflow, we were using the dnf Ansible
module to ensure that the right streams were enabled. However,
the dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Installing packages which were
not installed before the update.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled). Letting the minor update's
workflow 'dnf update *' take care of installing the packages.

Change-Id: I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f
Related-bug: rhbz#1963164
"}]
commit_message:
Replace dnf by tripleo_dnf_stream for updates.

In the minor update workflow, we were using the dnf Ansible
module to ensure that the right streams were enabled. However,
the dnf Ansible module doesn't only enable the stream, but
synchronizes the whole content. Installing packages which were
not installed before the update.

This patch replaces the dnf Ansible module by a custom tripleo
module, tripleo_dnf_stream, which will only enable the stream
(if the stream wasn't enabled). Letting the minor update's
workflow 'dnf update *' take care of installing the packages.

Change-Id: I3fa4ccc224cf510bcc85a9c86a2b4f0d367c687f
Related-bug: rhbz#1963164

subject: Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2022-02-16 01:23:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 8449, 'date': '2022-02-16 07:34:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 01:23:07.000000000', 'message': 'Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf

This patch fixes a problem that causes a stack update to fail as a
result of changing the multipathd configuration. The original code
modifies /etc/multipath.conf on the host, and uses "podman cp" to
refresh the contents of the containers that require a copy.

The original intent was to avoid restarting containers that
asynchronously read from /etc/multipath.conf, but that approach no
longer works. Instead, the new code restarts each container that
needs its multipath.conf file refreshed.

At some point, podman (or something related) started using locks on
files used in a container volume mount. Now, attempts to update the
contents of /etc/multipath.conf inside a container will fail. Here's
an example when running the same command that tripleo_multipathd
executes:

[root@standalone ~]# podman cp /etc/multipath.conf multipathd:/etc/
Error: 2 errors occurred:
        * error copying to container: copier: put: error creating "/etc/multipath.conf": copier: put: error removing item to be overwritten "/etc/multipath.conf": unlinkat /etc/multipath.conf: device or resource busy
        * error copying from host: copier: get: "/etc/multipath.conf": error copying /etc/multipath.conf: io: read/write on closed pipe

Depends-On: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
Change-Id: I6bd5249e3cf930108f93aee1dbcad76dda94eaee
(cherry picked from commit 91768c6e69d51bfee2aade96c3a7134096520982)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix how tripleo_multipathd updates multipath.conf

This patch fixes a problem that causes a stack update to fail as a
result of changing the multipathd configuration. The original code
modifies /etc/multipath.conf on the host, and uses "podman cp" to
refresh the contents of the containers that require a copy.

The original intent was to avoid restarting containers that
asynchronously read from /etc/multipath.conf, but that approach no
longer works. Instead, the new code restarts each container that
needs its multipath.conf file refreshed.

At some point, podman (or something related) started using locks on
files used in a container volume mount. Now, attempts to update the
contents of /etc/multipath.conf inside a container will fail. Here's
an example when running the same command that tripleo_multipathd
executes:

[root@standalone ~]# podman cp /etc/multipath.conf multipathd:/etc/
Error: 2 errors occurred:
        * error copying to container: copier: put: error creating "/etc/multipath.conf": copier: put: error removing item to be overwritten "/etc/multipath.conf": unlinkat /etc/multipath.conf: device or resource busy
        * error copying from host: copier: get: "/etc/multipath.conf": error copying /etc/multipath.conf: io: read/write on closed pipe

Depends-On: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
Change-Id: I6bd5249e3cf930108f93aee1dbcad76dda94eaee
(cherry picked from commit 91768c6e69d51bfee2aade96c3a7134096520982)

commit_message:
Failure to generate hostnqn in case missing "show-hostnqn" sub-command

Environment:
- openstack version: Xena
- kolla on ubuntu focal 20.04
the installed version of nvme is 1.9, this version doesn't have the
command "show-hostnqn".
In case of missing hostnqn file, it will fail to create hostnqn
the exit error code is 231 and is not caught by the
try-except block.

Here we try to parse the stdout to check if the
subcommand (show-hostnqn) is not supported.
if its not, we continue to try and create the hostnqn.

Change-Id: I318f167baa0ba7789f4ca2c7c12a8de5568195e0

subject: Don't bind host's /run in multipathd container
messages: [{'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2022-02-16 01:09:41.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 21129, 'date': '2022-02-16 01:22:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: New patch set was added with same tree, parent, and commit message as Patch Set 1.'}, {'account_id': 7144, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:40:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-16 01:09:41.000000000', 'message': "Don't bind host's /run in multipathd container

The multipathd daemon uses a hard-coded pidfile path that conflicts
with the one we use for conmon on the host. If we bind /run:/run
then multipathd overwrites the host file with its own pid, and this
interferes with systemd's ability to manage the service via the
pidfile. systemd expects the pidfile to contain the host's conmon
pid, not the multipathd daemon's pid.

Change-Id: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
(cherry picked from commit 3ae6ce355c61ec64da0010f1b20a329233dd03ef)
"}, {'created': '2022-02-16 01:22:59.000000000', 'message': "Don't bind host's /run in multipathd container

The multipathd daemon uses a hard-coded pidfile path that conflicts
with the one we use for conmon on the host. If we bind /run:/run
then multipathd overwrites the host file with its own pid, and this
interferes with systemd's ability to manage the service via the
pidfile. systemd expects the pidfile to contain the host's conmon
pid, not the multipathd daemon's pid.

Change-Id: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
(cherry picked from commit 3ae6ce355c61ec64da0010f1b20a329233dd03ef)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't bind host's /run in multipathd container

The multipathd daemon uses a hard-coded pidfile path that conflicts
with the one we use for conmon on the host. If we bind /run:/run
then multipathd overwrites the host file with its own pid, and this
interferes with systemd's ability to manage the service via the
pidfile. systemd expects the pidfile to contain the host's conmon
pid, not the multipathd daemon's pid.

Change-Id: Ia6a8d27fd2ae6310544bc3767cf7f1fb246939c3
(cherry picked from commit 3ae6ce355c61ec64da0010f1b20a329233dd03ef)

This patch removes the lower-constraint job from the stable/xena branch.

This is part of a series of patches that will remove the job from all stable
branches of Designate.

The lower constraint check is important on the master branch to make sure that
new patches are tested against the lowest supported version of dependencies.
This helps packagers make sure they have at least the minimum version of a
dependency packaged along with the service.
After a release and the stable branch is created, these jobs can cause
problems maintaining the stable branches as bug fix patches are released for
the dependency projects.

master branch, but disable it on the stable branches.

commit_message:
Remove lower-constraint job from stable/xena

This patch removes the lower-constraint job from the stable/xena branch.

This is part of a series of patches that will remove the job from all stable
branches of Designate.

The lower constraint check is important on the master branch to make sure that
new patches are tested against the lowest supported version of dependencies.
This helps packagers make sure they have at least the minimum version of a
dependency packaged along with the service.
After a release and the stable branch is created, these jobs can cause
problems maintaining the stable branches as bug fix patches are released for
the dependency projects.
For this reason, we are proposing to maintain the lower-constraints job on the
master branch, but disable it on the stable branches.

Change-Id: I70906ca7964638a1b867256617ac898ea3d7f983

subject: setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores
messages: [{'account_id': 9816, 'date': '2022-02-05 16:42:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 22623, 'date': '2022-02-05 18:31:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 11628, 'date': '2022-02-17 21:19:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1\n\n(1 comment)'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-05 16:42:19.000000000', 'message': "setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I0c8e6a3a474a5cfa029b741b1a26b7d48d244206
"}]
commit_message:
setup.cfg: Replace dashes by underscores

Since setuptools v54.1.0[1], the parmeters with dash have been
deprecated in favor of the new parameters with underscore.

This change updates the parameters accordingly to avoid the warnings
like the example below.

  UserWarning: Usage of dash-separated 'description-file' will not be
  supported in future versions. Please use the underscore name
  'description_file' instead

[1] https://github.com/pypa/setuptools/commit/a2e9ae4cb

Change-Id: I0c8e6a3a474a5cfa029b741b1a26b7d48d244206

commit_message:
Move context from tenant to project_id

in the sudo context unit test:
DeprecationWarning: Property 'tenant' has moved to 'project_id'
in version '2.6' and will be removed in version '3.0'

oslo_context is deprecating the tenant field, so move to using
project_id. This does leave a less than ideal state where both
project_id and tenant are referenced (since all_tenants remains
untouched) but replacing 'tenant' with 'project' across the
entire codebase is a much larger task.

Change-Id: Id78112b49d5c0e99064fcb271aaded871da3f633

commit_message:
Do not assert TCP/80

Assersion of TCP/80 was added to check placement API but now it is
managed by a separate puppet module which is puppet-placement.
Also, puppet-placement currently uses a different port by default.

Change-Id: Ifbe180311c88957a5f3316e1a1588277a04f44b9

revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-04 12:12:34.000000000', 'message': 'Skip podman purge on Undercloud

With the undercloud using ephemeral Heat, there will be images for
ephemeral Heat in the local container storage that do not have any
associated containers. Podman purge would delete these images, and they
then wouldn't be available for overcloud commands.

Instead, skip running the podman purge tasks on the Undercloud. This
means that the local container image storage will grow over time. Given
the reduced number of services on the undercloud, the storage usage is
not as bad as it was previously. However, operators will need to be
aware.

While "podman image prune" does have a --filter option to preserve
images, it does not work in the version of podman in
container-tools:3.0. When the needed patch[1] is available, the podman
purge tasks can be re-enabled, which would address the issue of growing
local storage.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/commit/a5ad36c65ea07d839fd9bf55a820c8cb9884eed1
[2] https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/10390

Change-Id: Ibd2200aa912960b267a9975571e05665a29e40f0
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7eb280ace819e7fa7d8e16a6328a5b3ff6fa00a5)
'}]
commit_message:
Skip podman purge on Undercloud

With the undercloud using ephemeral Heat, there will be images for
ephemeral Heat in the local container storage that do not have any
associated containers. Podman purge would delete these images, and they
then wouldn't be available for overcloud commands.

Instead, skip running the podman purge tasks on the Undercloud. This
means that the local container image storage will grow over time. Given
the reduced number of services on the undercloud, the storage usage is
not as bad as it was previously. However, operators will need to be
aware.

While "podman image prune" does have a --filter option to preserve
images, it does not work in the version of podman in
container-tools:3.0. When the needed patch[1] is available, the podman
purge tasks can be re-enabled, which would address the issue of growing
local storage.

[1] https://github.com/containers/podman/commit/a5ad36c65ea07d839fd9bf55a820c8cb9884eed1
[2] https://github.com/containers/podman/pull/10390

Change-Id: Ibd2200aa912960b267a9975571e05665a29e40f0
Signed-off-by: James Slagle <jslagle@redhat.com>
(cherry picked from commit 7eb280ace819e7fa7d8e16a6328a5b3ff6fa00a5)

subject: CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default
messages:
[{'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2022-02-17 11:52:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 19339, 'date': '2022-02-17 11:52:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Zuul encountered a syntax error while parsing its configuration in the
repo openstack/ironic on branch stable/wallaby.  The error was:

  Unknown projects: opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector

The error appears in the following job stanza:

  job:
      name: ironic-inspector-tempest-partition-bios-redfish-vmedia
      description: "Inspect and deploy ironic node over Redfish virtual media using legacy BIOS boot mode"
      parent: ironic-tempest-partition-uefi-redfish-vmedia
      required-projects:
        - opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
      vars:
        # NOTE(dtantsur): the inspector job includes booting an instance too.
        # Excluding the abort tests since it hits "node locked" too often.
        tempest_test_regex: test_baremetal_introspection
        devstack_localrc:
          IRONIC_BOOT_MODE: bios
          IRONIC_DEFAULT_BOOT_OPTION: netboot
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_MANAGED_BOOT: True
          IRONIC_INSPECTOR_NODE_NOT_FOUND_HOOK: ''
          IRONIC_AUTOMATED_CLEAN_ENABLED: False
          IRONIC_VM_COUNT: 1
        devstack_plugins:
          ironic-inspector: https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic-inspector
        devstack_services:
          ironic-inspector: True
          ironic-inspector-dhcp: True

  in "openstack/ironic/zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml@stable/wallaby", line 241, column 3
For 3rd party CI contact info: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ThirdPartySystems/DellEMC_Ironic_CI'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2022-02-17 14:02:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2022-02-17 11:52:31.000000000', 'message': "CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default

Cirros partition images are not compatible with local boot since they
don't ship grub (nor a normal root partition). This change adds a script
that builds a partition image with UEFI artifacts present. It still
cannot be booted in legacy mode, but it's a progress.

Set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option. We need it to inform
the tempest plugin about the ability to do local boot. This option
already exists but is never set.

Also set the new default_boot_option parameter, which will be introduced
and used in Iaba563a2ecbca029889bc6894b2a7f0754d27b88.

Remove netboot from most of the UEFI jobs.

Conflicts:
	devstack/files/bindep.txt
	zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I15189e7f5928126c6b336b1416ce6408a4950062
(cherry picked from commit bbceca562e0b552cd2fc33b2833931ab3cbbfce5)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: use a custom cirros partition image instead of the default

Cirros partition images are not compatible with local boot since they
don't ship grub (nor a normal root partition). This change adds a script
that builds a partition image with UEFI artifacts present. It still
cannot be booted in legacy mode, but it's a progress.

Set the tempest plugin's partition_netboot option. We need it to inform
the tempest plugin about the ability to do local boot. This option
already exists but is never set.

Also set the new default_boot_option parameter, which will be introduced
and used in Iaba563a2ecbca029889bc6894b2a7f0754d27b88.

Remove netboot from most of the UEFI jobs.

Conflicts:
	devstack/files/bindep.txt
	zuul.d/ironic-jobs.yaml

Change-Id: I15189e7f5928126c6b336b1416ce6408a4950062
(cherry picked from commit bbceca562e0b552cd2fc33b2833931ab3cbbfce5)

The puppt-postgresql module does not support CentOS 9 yet and requires
some version parameters to be run on CentOS 9. This change disables
unit tests requiring that module, until the module supports CentOS 9.

commit_message:
CentOS 9: Disable unit tests dependent on puppet-postgresql

The puppt-postgresql module does not support CentOS 9 yet and requires
some version parameters to be run on CentOS 9. This change disables
unit tests requiring that module, until the module supports CentOS 9.

Change-Id: I7093330bdbae4965954d4a2a5f5d6a2c56fd15e1

commit_message:
Create random character devices so systemd does not crash

Systemd, depending on the version and the configuration,
can attempt to open urandom when a ramdisk boots, before
the udevd is launched to handle the devices. In particular
in FIPS mode, this can result in the ramdisk crashing.

In order to handle this, we pre-create the chracter device
files which can be statically used in the early start sequence
to allow the agent to boot and deploy.

Change-Id: I587e66a0d6b652c4aeca6fc211602d999d4641e8
